title: What is the Female Innovation Index?
question: What does the Female Innovation Index do?
answer: The Female Innovation Index benchmarks innovation initiatives led by women-founded companies and highlights emerging trends across European ecosystems.

title: How does the chatbot handle personal data?
question: What happens to my data if I use the chatbot?
answer: Conversations are stored securely for quality assurance and deleted after 90 days unless you opt in to ongoing support. We never sell personal data.

title: How can I join the community?
question: I want to join the Female Foundry community. What should I do?
answer: Submit the membership form on our website and our team will schedule a welcome call within five business days.

title: Support channel when chatbot cannot help
question: What if the chatbot cannot answer my question?
answer: If the chatbot cannot assist, it will offer to escalate your request to the Female Foundry support inbox. You will receive a human response within one business day.

title: Survey results: fundraising difficulty in 2024
question: What did founders report about fundraising difficulty in 2024?
answer:
Female Foundry’s 2024 survey asked 682 early-stage founders and 83 growth-stage founders how the fundraising climate changed versus the prior year.

Early-stage responses (n = 682):
• Significantly harder – 83 founders (12%)
• Harder – 170 (25%)
• No change – 223 (33%)
• Easier – 34 (5%)
• Significantly easier – 12 (2%)
• I don’t know – 160 (24%)

Growth-stage responses (n = 83):
• Significantly harder – 10 founders (12%)
• Harder – 16 (19%)
• No change – 38 (46%)
• Easier – 5 (6%)
• Significantly easier – 0 (0%)
• I don’t know – 14 (17%)

In short, most growth founders reported “no change,” while early-stage founders were more evenly split between harder, unchanged, and unsure.

title: Survey results: inhibitors of innovation by sector (2024)
question: What are the biggest inhibitors of innovation for female-founded companies by sector?
answer:
Respondents highlighted different bottlenecks per sector (counts show number of mentions in the 2024 Female Foundry survey):

• Sustainability (n=89): top blockers were access to funding (46 mentions, 10%), slow adoption of technology (38, 11%), regulatory barriers (24, 12%), and cultural norms (19, 11%).
• Fintech (n=91): access to funding (45, 10%) dominated, followed by slow adoption of technology (45, 13%) and economic uncertainty (17, 9%).
• Deeptech (n=59): access to funding (30, 6%), slow adoption (24, 7%), and talent shortage (6, 7%) were the most-cited issues.
• Health (n=167): access to funding (101, 21%), economic uncertainty (49, 27%), slow adoption (59, 17%), and cultural norms (36, 20%).
• Data & AI (n=136): access to funding (67, 14%), economic uncertainty (24, 13%), slow adoption (47, 14%), and cultural norms (29, 16%).
• Mobility (n=63): access to funding (29, 7%) and regulatory barriers (11, 6%) led.
• Education (n=52): access to funding (28, 6%), slow adoption (27, 8%), and regulatory barriers (16, 8%).
• E-commerce (n=49): economic uncertainty (12, 7%) and access to funding (18, 4%) were highest.
• Marketing, Cyber Security, Food, Entertainment, and “Other” sectors show similar patterns—access to funding is the single most common inhibitor overall (470 mentions across all sectors), followed by slow adoption of technology (340) and economic uncertainty (184).

title: Macroeconomic context: inflation and interest rates (2020-2024)
question: What does the Innovation Index report about inflation and interest rates in Europe between 2020 and 2024?
answer:
Female Foundry’s macro analysis combines OECD and central bank data for key markets:

Year-on-year inflation (%):
• UK – 1.0 (2020), 2.5 (2021), 7.9 (2022), 8.6 (2023), 3.3 (2024)
• Germany – 0.4, 3.2, 8.7, 6.0, 2.5
• Poland – 3.7, 5.2, 13.2, 10.9, 3.7
• EU (aggregate) – 0.7, 2.9, 9.2, 6.4, 2.6

Policy-relevant central bank interest rates (%):
• UK (Bank of England) – 0.10 (2020), 0.10 (2021), 3.50 (2022), 5.25 (2023), 4.75 (2024)
• Germany / Eurozone (ECB) – 0.00, 0.00, 2.50, 4.50, 3.15
• Poland (NBP) – 0.10, 1.75, 6.75, 5.75, 5.75
• EU (aggregate) – 0.00, 0.00, 2.50, 4.25, 3.65

The commentary notes that UK inflation peaked highest, while Poland faced persistently higher inflation. Central banks tightened rates in 2022–2023 and eased slightly in 2024.

title: IPO activity 2019-2024
question: How many IPOs happened in Europe according to the Female Innovation Index?
answer:
Dealroom data compiled for the Innovation Index shows IPO counts per year (2019–2024):

United Kingdom – 55 (2019), 40 (2020), 57 (2021), 44 (2022), 22 (2023), 26 (2024)
Germany – 23, 8, 14, 7, 7, 7
Poland – 19, 23, 63, 21, 11, 12
EU (all countries combined) – 400, 523, 962, 325, 258, 217

The commentary highlights the surge in 2021, followed by a pullback in 2022–2023 and modest activity in 2024.

title: Headline statistics on European female founders (2024)
question: Give me overall statistics about European female founders from the Innovation Index.
answer:
According to the Female Innovation Index 2025 edition:
• Female-founded startups in Europe raised €5.76B across 1,305 deals in 2024, covering 1,196 companies. That equals roughly 12% of total European VC deployed that year.
• Deep tech accounts for about one-third of the capital raised by female founders—roughly 33% of 2024 VC into women-led startups.
• When mixed-gender founding teams are counted, women-linked startups capture ~12% of all funding; the familiar “2%” statistic refers only to all-female founding teams.
• The Index aggregates 1,200+ survey responses and tracks 145,000+ companies, offering a comprehensive view across stages, sectors, and geographies.
